Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC GROUP IDENTIFIER: this is the seismic set id of the set into which theinput seis sets have been grouped.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.3: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.
Column Comment.4: COMPONENT ID: Unique identifier for the component.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: CORNER LATITUDE: Latitude of a corner of the area in a seismic set that has beenincorporated into another set.
Column Comment.7: CORNER LONGITUDE: the longitude of a corner of a 3D set that has beenincorporated into another set.
Column Comment.8: CORNER LATITUDE: Latitude of a corner of the area in a seismic set that has beenincorporated into another set.
Column Comment.9: CORNER LONGITUDE: the longitude of a corner of a 3D set that has beenincorporated into another set.
Column Comment.10: CORNER LATITUDE: Latitude of a corner of the area in a seismic set that has beenincorporated into another set.
Column Comment.11: CORNER LONGITUDE: the longitude of a corner of a 3D set that has beenincorporated into another set.
Column Comment.12: DESCRIPTION: text based description of the seis set or part of a seis set that hasbeen included into the new seis set.
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.14: EXCLUSION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag that indicates the area references wasEXCLUDED from the resulting sesimic set.
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.16: INCLUSION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag that indicates the area references wasINCLUDED in the resulting set.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: GROUP TYPE: The type of group that is created. Groups can be created toassociate a survey with the 2D or 3D sets acquired with it, to indicate what sets arecombined into a processing or interepretation data set or to associate lines andsegment
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
